My Blog

Mainframe Development: Why I like Cobol

Introduction

COBOL has been around since 1959, I was introduced to it in my 2nd year in school, with the course Mainframe Development. COBOL powers systems in banking, healthcare, government, and many other more legacy systems. Even though it may not be everyone's cup of tea, I find Cobol very interesting. I work directly with a mainframe environment using Vista and there's also the option to work with IBM's IDE to connect to the mainframe for ease of use.

Why Cobol?

Like I mentioned earlier, Cobol is considered to be outdated and there's a shortage of Cobol developers as senior developers are retiring or already retired. With that, I believe there's a lot of opportunities for younger developers like me to get into the industry. I've also learned that there is a growing interest in integrating Cobol systems with newer technologies to work with legacy systems instead of completely getting rid of them.

My Goals with Cobol

I'm super eager to use what I learned in real-life projects, and make my way into the banking industry or healthcare industry that uses legacy systems.
